p.s: In the following I'm going to analyse the article Is the usefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights coming to an end? The answer is yes published in The Gulf News on 24th November 2011 by Brian Pollard focusing on his use of stylistic devices and communicative strategysstrategies.

By using the emmerationenumeration [...] good working conditions, good wages, and safe working environments [...] (l. 7-8) and the Anaphoreanaphora Unions... (l. 7), Today unions [...] (l. 10), Unions [...] (l. 10) he makes clear how much unions have changed as he gives a lot of examples.
By this he also compares them directly I've long supported unions [...] (l. 5), Unions are no longer [...] (l. 7).

The parallelism ... workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employees (l. 19) he expresses that the situation now doesn't just differ from before but has completely turned around.
He also uses the metaphor economic mess (l. 24) in order to illustrate how bad the economic situation of the world is.
By these stylistic devices he shows the contrast of how unions have evolved.
But he also puts across that he really much supports the original idea of unions and appreciates the positive impact they had.
To communicate this he always compares the past to now (2011 in this case).
